snippet: The text of Proposition 22, which appears on the ballot of California's primary on Tuesday, contains only 14 words. But it is one of the more mean-spirited measures to come along in any election in quite a while.     Also known as the Knight Initi...
lead_paragraph: The text of Proposition 22, which appears on the ballot of California's primary on Tuesday, contains only 14 words. But it is one of the more mean-spirited measures to come along in any election in quite a while. Also known as the Knight Initiative for its staunchly anti-gay Republican author, State Senator William Knight, Proposition 22 would revise the California Family Code to say that ''Only marriage between a man and a woman is valid or recognized in California.'' Although billed as a necessary step to protect the institution of marriage and ''traditional'' families, it is in fact a divisive exercise in wedge politics.
abstract: Editorial urges California voters to reject initiative on primary ballot under which only marriage between a man and a woman would valid or recognized in state
